text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/30fd8204cecb317d842b964d624d492088d6d15f|patch 8.2.1744: Vim9: using ":const!" is weird>
patch 8.2.1744: Vim9: using ":const!" is weird

Problem:    Vim9: using ":const!" is weird.
Solution:   Use "var" - "final" - "const" like Dart.  "let" still works for
            now.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1744: Vim9: using ":const!" is weird · vim/vim@30fd820
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1744: Vim9: using ":const!" is weird · vim/vim@30fd820
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: using ":const!" is weird. Solution: Use "var" - "final" - "const" like Dart. "let" still works for now.

Solution:   Move shorten_dir outside of #ifdef.

patch 8.2.1741: pathshorten() only supports using one character

Problem:    pathshorten() only supports using one character.
Solution:   Add an argument to control the length. (closes #7006)

patch 8.2.1740: test fails without the terminal feature

Problem:    Test fails without the terminal feature.
Solution:   Skip test if the terminal feature is not available.

patch 8.2.1739: Vim9: crash when compiling a manually defined function

Problem:    Vim9: crash when compiling a manually defined function. (Antony
            Scriven)
Solution:   Check that the script ID is positive. (closes #7012)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1739: Vim9: crash when compiling a manually defined function · vim/vim@9c4f552
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1739: Vim9: crash when compiling a manually defined function · vim/vim@9c4f552
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: crash when compiling a manually defined function. (Antony Scriven) Solution: Check that the script ID is positive. (closes #7012)
